tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Possible meanings are 1) David wrote the psalm or 2) the psalm is about David or 3) the psalm is in the style of David's psalms.
The phrase "my right hand" refers to the place of honor. AT: "Sit at the place of honor which I have for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

Here David describes Yahweh placing his master's enemies under his power and control as putting them under his feet like a footstool. AT: "put your enemies under your power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
General Information: David continues speaking to the king.

tn.ref: Yahweh will hold out the scepter of your strength
tn.text: Here David speaks of Yahweh extending the area that the king rules as holding out his scepter. AT: "Yahweh will extend the area over which you powerfully rule" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"King, rule among your enemies." This is spoken to the king as a command.
"by their own choice." This means that they will chose to follow the king.

tn.ref: on the day of your power
tn.text: This refers to the day that the king will lead his armies into battle. This can be stated clearly. AT: "on the day that you lead your armies into battle" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: from the womb of the dawn ... like the dew
tn.text: David describes the dew as a baby to whom the dawn gives birth. AT: "in the morning ... like the dew" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: from the womb of the dawn your youth will be to you like the dew
tn.text: David is telling the king that he will have youthful strength each morning by comparing it to how the dew appears early each morning. AT: "each morning you will be filled with youthful strength to sustain you just like each morning the dew appears to water and sustain the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh is speaking to the lord.
This means that he will not change what he has said. AT: "will not change his mind" or "will not change what he has said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The missing words may be added. AT: "after the manner that Melchizedek was priest" or "in the same way that Melchizedek was priest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: The Lord is at your right hand
tn.text: When the lord goes to battle, Yahweh stands at his right hand in order to help him. AT: "The Lord helps you in battle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "Lord" refers to Yahweh.

The word "He" refers to Yahweh. He will cause the kings to be defeated and die, but he will allow the king's armies to kill the enemy kings. AT: "He will cause the kings to die" or "He will allow your armies to kill the kings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to his enemies. AT: "enemy kings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: on the day of his anger
tn.text: Here David speaks of the day when Yahweh will become angry and defeat the kings as "the day of his anger." AT: "on the day of judgment when his patience turns to anger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: he will fill the battlegrounds with dead bodies
tn.text: This means that Yahweh will cause this to happen, not that he will personally kill all of the people who die on the battleground. AT: "he will cause the battlegrounds to be filled with death bodies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: he will kill the leaders in many countries
tn.text: This means that Yahweh will cause this to happen, not that he will personally kill the leaders. AT: "he will cause the leaders in many countries to be killed" or "he will allow the leaders in many countries to die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: He will drink of the brook along the road
tn.text: The king only stops briefly for a drink and then he continues the pursuit of his enemies. AT: "As he pursues his enemies, he will only stop to drink quickly from a brook" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This means the he will drink water from the brook. A brook is a small stream. AT: "he will drink water from the brook" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"and so" or "therefore"
Possible meanings are 1) the king lifts up his own head or 2) Yahweh lifts up the head of the king.

tn.ref: he will lift his head up high after victory
tn.text: People raised their heads when they are victorious, confident, and joyful. AT: "he will confidently lift his head after victory" or "he will be victorious" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
